stories.title: Life is a Game of Problems

steps.title: Problems Everywhere
steps.narration: Here's something most people never realize: the world is full of problems waiting to be solved. Every single day, everywhere you look, there are problems. Some are small, some are huge.

steps.title: The Secret
steps.narration: The people who make the most money, have the most impact, and live the most interesting lives are the ones who get really good at solving problems. That's the secret.

steps.title: Simple Problems
steps.narration: Someone's hungry? That's a problem. Make them food, problem solved. Small reward, but real value created. This is where everyone starts.

steps.title: Medium Problems
steps.narration: A business needs a website? That's a bigger problem. Build it, problem solved. Bigger reward, more value created. Now you're moving up.

steps.title: Hard Problems
steps.narration: A community needs better education? That's a hard problem. Solve it and you get massive reward, massive impact. The harder the problem you can solve, the bigger the reward. Simple as that.

steps.title: The Old Way
steps.narration: Historically, solving hard problems required years of education, expensive degrees, and lucky opportunities. Only certain people got access. That was the old game, and the deck was stacked against most people.

steps.title: Years of School
steps.narration: First you needed years of school. Then an expensive degree. Then you had to hope for a lucky opportunity. And maybe, just maybe, you could solve the problem. Most people never got that chance.

steps.title: The New Way
steps.narration: AI changes everything. Now the path is shorter. You see a problem, you ask questions, you use AI, you build a solution. No fancy degree required. No waiting years.

steps.title: The Real Skill
steps.narration: AI is like having access to all the world's knowledge. But knowledge alone doesn't solve problems. The real skill is knowing what questions to ask. That's what separates problem solvers from everyone else.

steps.title: Infinitely Patient Teacher
steps.narration: Here's something beautiful: AI never gets tired of your questions. It never gets irritated. Ask it a thousand questions in a row and it doesn't care. For the first time in history, you have access to an infinitely patient teacher.

steps.title: Your New Superpower
steps.narration: This is revolutionary. You can learn things faster, understand problems deeper, and build real solutions. All you need is curiosity and the willingness to ask questions. That's your new superpower.

stories.title: The Art of Questions: 6 Levels Deep

steps.title: Most People Stop Here
steps.narration: Most people ask one or two questions about something and think they understand it. They don't. They're swimming at the surface while the real insights are deep below.

steps.title: Level 1: Why?
steps.narration: Let's say a business is struggling. Level one: Why is the business struggling? Answer: because they don't have enough customers. Most people would stop here. Not you.

steps.title: Level 2: Why?
steps.narration: Level two: Why don't they have enough customers? Answer: because people don't know about them. We're going deeper. Keep asking.

steps.title: Level 3: Why?
steps.narration: Level three: Why don't people know about them? Answer: because they have no online presence. Now we're starting to see the real problem.

steps.title: Levels 4 & 5: Going Deeper
steps.narration: Levels four and five: Why no online presence? Because they don't know how to build one. Why not? Because it seems too technical and expensive. We're almost at the root.

steps.title: Level 6: The Real Problem
steps.narration: Level six: Why does it seem too technical and expensive? Because they don't know about AI tools that make it easy and free. Now we've found a problem we can actually solve!

steps.title: The Key Insight
steps.narration: If you can get just two or three levels deeper than most people, you're already ahead of ninety-nine percent of the world. Most people accept surface-level answers. You won't.

questions.question: According to the lesson, what determines how much reward you get for solving a problem?
options: How many people know about it
questions.explanation: The harder the problem you can solve, the bigger the reward. Simple problems = small rewards, hard problems = massive rewards.

questions.question: What's 'the secret' that the most successful people understand?
options: They're really good at solving problems
They work harder than everyone else
questions.explanation: The secret is that people who make the most impact and have the most interesting lives are those who get really good at solving problems.

questions.question: What's an example of a 'hard problem' mentioned in the lesson?
options: Making someone food when they're hungry
Building a website for a business
questions.explanation: A community needing better education is a hard problem - solving it leads to massive reward and massive impact.

questions.question: What was required to solve hard problems in 'the old way'?
options: Years of education, expensive degrees, and lucky opportunities
Knowing the right questions to ask
questions.explanation: Historically, solving hard problems required years of education, expensive degrees, and lucky opportunities - only certain people got access.

questions.question: According to the lesson, what's 'the real skill' needed to solve problems with AI?
questions.explanation: AI gives you access to knowledge, but the real skill is knowing what questions to ask. That's what separates problem solvers from everyone else.

questions.question: Why is AI described as an 'infinitely patient teacher'?
options: It never gets tired or irritated by your questions
questions.explanation: Unlike humans who have limits and can get irritated, AI will answer any question without getting tired or frustrated - even if you ask a thousand questions in a row.

questions.question: How many levels deep do most people go when asking questions?
questions.explanation: Most people ask 1-2 questions about something and think they understand it. Real understanding comes from going 6 levels deep.

questions.question: In the business example, what was discovered at level 6?
options: The owners should go back to school
They didn't know about AI tools that make building an online presence easy and free
They needed to hire more employees
questions.explanation: At level 6, we discovered that the real root problem was that they didn't know about AI tools that could help them build an online presence easily and for free.

questions.question: According to the lesson, how many levels deeper than most people do you need to go to be ahead of 99% of the world?
questions.explanation: If you can get just 2-3 levels deeper than most people, you're already ahead of 99% of the world. Most people accept surface-level answers.
